suffixes.meaning: agent, one who does, coming out
suffixes.usage: noun suffix for collective/comprehensive meaning

suffixes.meaning: present tense: I do, currently doing
suffixes.usage: Used with middle -xon-; does require -ra in the pronoun
examples: Medicoi Bewai (singing as I become doctor)

suffixes.usage: verb suffix
examples: joyoaketaanara (having placed themselves in line all around)

suffixes.usage: verb suffix indicating immediate future action

suffixes.meaning: fully, to completion; having done so
suffixes.usage: verb suffix for completive aspect
nominalizing suffix
perfective or sequential suffix

suffixes.meaning: to do, to be in a certain way (infinitive/root marker)
suffixes.usage: infinitive/root form marker
examples: neskati (to be or do in a certain way)

suffixes.meaning: once it has been done, as soon as it has happened; expresses a completed action and an immediate subsequent action
suffixes.usage: used to describe past events in icaros and spoken language
verbal suffix indicating action performed while progressing
examples: joyobaintaanara (having placed themselves in line along the way)
chankabaintaanara (having stood up along the way)

suffixes.meaning: along the way, in a line
suffixes.usage: locative/directional suffix
verbal suffix indicating immediate or imminent action
verbal suffix
Used with middle -xon-; does not require -ra in the pronoun
examples: xobo katemabanon (will make them surround the house)
mana manamabanon (I will make them wait)
kepenyonxonbanon (I will open fully for you)

suffixes.usage: verb suffix for emphatic or assertive action
instrumental case marker
nominal/adjectival suffix indicating uniqueness and affection

suffixes.meaning: plural (for nouns); do as you go (for verbs)
suffixes.usage: Nominal or adjectival plural marker
Attached to verbs to create present participle form
verb suffix marking progressive/gerundive aspect
Suffix indicating temporal or circumstantial action
creates diminutive or affectionate forms
authenticity marker
temporal verb suffix
nominal suffix indicating specificity or emphasis
material marker suffix

suffixes.meaning: want, desire in the present tense
suffixes.usage: composed of -kas (want, desire) + -ai (present tense)

suffixes.meaning: do not want, do not desire in the present tense
suffixes.usage: composed of -kasham (don't want, don't desire) + -ai (present tense)

suffixes.meaning: to seldom do so, emphasis, certainly without a doubt
suffixes.usage: verb suffix with dual meaning of rarity and certainty
tense suffix used with verbs
pronoun and nominal suffix
examples: koirantiki yoikin (tell them to take care)
tsonbibiki (for no one to find me)

suffixes.meaning: present participle (-ing), one degree less present, more descriptive
suffixes.usage: verbal suffix for present participle and descriptive aspect
examples: mayamabokin (making it circle around the house as I go)

suffixes.meaning: progressive aspect, as I go/ongoing action
suffixes.usage: verbal suffix indicating continuous or progressive action
examples: payanbokinra (I am blowing away as I go)
nete kepenbokinra (I go on opening the universe)

suffixes.usage: verb suffix for negative meaning
examples: nokon joi ninkamai (make them listen to my words)

suffixes.usage: Marks instrumental case; indicates using/with
Suffix denoting possibility or potential to happen
examples: raminaketiankan (from ramiti, possibility of becoming distorted)

suffixes.meaning: agent marker for transitive verbs, denoting the one doing the action
suffixes.usage: Pairs with transitive verbs to mark the agent
future tense marker for announced actions
nominal suffix indicating absence or negation
verb suffix indicating future or command
adjective/verb suffix
Required with certain tense suffixes like -ai; marks the object of the action
Emphasizes the specific action itself
verb suffix
verbal suffix indicating repetition or reiteration
examples: Paoyonribataana (having fully put on the belt, stole, or band one more time)

suffixes.usage: noun suffix for singularity and endearment
verbal suffix indicating excellent or superior execution of an action
adverbial intensifier suffix
Adverbial suffix indicating manner
adverbial suffix expressing quality or manner

suffixes.meaning: having done so, having completed the action
suffixes.usage: verbal suffix indicating completed or perfective aspect
examples: chankamayontaanara (having made it stand up fully)
Paoyonribataana (having fully put on the belt, one more time)

suffixes.usage: Temporal suffix marking time or duration
used with negation to form imperative commands

suffixes.meaning: once I have done; expresses a completed action and a not so immediate subsequent action
suffixes.usage: Goes right after the root of a transitive verb; requires other suffixes (tenses, commands) to follow; requires a transitive pronoun (en, min, jan, etc.) before it; makes all verbs transitive in nature
examples: axonai (I do it for another, present)

suffixes.usage: verb suffix for immediate action announcement
Inclusive marker indicating 'with all'
attached to verb stems, followed by tense markers
verbal suffix indicating complete or thorough action
examples: chankamayontaanara (having made it stand up fully)
Paoyonribataana (having fully put on the belt)

suffixes.meaning: having fully done, fully made, complete action
suffixes.usage: Completive aspect suffix indicating thorough or complete action
verbal suffix
